column4: what might this mean??? (WW) NVIDIA(GPU-0): Unable to read EDID for display device CRT-0
the EDID info is something you're monitor has in it to tell the video card what it's capable of. I can't imagine any LCD not working with that
yea do you think if the hsyc and the vsync were wrong in the xorg.conf would effect this
perhaps, but i'm not an x.org expert ;)
there anothe line above a lil bit that has troble to so i post that see what you think
(WW) NVIDIA: No matching Device section for instance (BusID PCI:5:0:0) found
so the driver basically doesn't recognize the card as something it can work with, it looks like
i was thinking the same thing. in my xorg.conf it says busid pci is 4:0:0. but this is saying 5:0:0 i think its finding my other card in here and woundering why there r 2
ahhh, well then I have no idea at all. I'm completely unfamiliar with that kind of setup
hence why i think xorg.is getiing confused
try removing one and see if it works then?
i did find and option in /etc/default/nvidia-kernal that it asks me how many cards are in the system
that is probably not referring to SLI setups
i was thinking the same thing
